main_text:
Dissolving Descriptions
6. Dissolving Descriptions

As noted in the beginning of this article, the Russellian account of
descriptions not only offers a quantificational as opposed to a
referential account of descriptions, but it packs three different
claims into the analysis of descriptions: an existence claim,
a uniqueness claim, and a maximality claim. As we
will see, all of these claims can be put under pressure, and all three
arguably collapse under that pressure. Let’s begin by examining
the uniqueness claim.
